required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic, Safety and Tolerability Study of Aclidinium/Formoterol Fixed Dose Combination and Formoterol in Patients With Moderate to Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2a, Randomized, Open-Label, 2-Way Crossover Study To Determine The Pharmacokinetics, Safety, And Tolerability Of Aclidinium/Formoterol 400/12 µg Fixed Dose Combination Via Almirall Inhaler And Formoterol 12 µg Via Foradil® Aerolizer® In Patients With Moderate To Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this Phase II study is to evaluate the pharmacokinetics, safety, and tolerability of aclidinium/formoterol fixed dose combination (FDC 400/12 μg via the Almirall Inhaler and formoterol 12 μg via the Foradil® Aerolizer®, both administered twice daily for five days to patients with moderate to severe COPD.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Formoterol Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve (AUC) Over Dosing Interval at Steady State
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: 0, 5, 15 and 30 min and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours (5 min before PM dose) and 5 and 15 min post PM dose; Days 2-4: 0, 5 and 15 min post dose; Day 5: 0, 5, 15 and 30 min and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours (post AM dose)
primary_outcome.description: The standard deviation of the measure is expressed as the coefficient of variation (%)

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Formoterol Plasma Drug Concentration (Cmax) at Steady State
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: 0, 5, 15 and 30 min and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours (5 min before PM dose) and 5 and 15 min post PM dose; Days 2-4: 0, 5 and 15 min post dose; Day 5: 0, 5, 15 and 30 min and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours (post AM dose)
primary_outcome.description: The standard deviation of the measure is expressed as the coefficient of variation (%)

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Formoterol Plasma Drug Concentration (Cmax) Following a Single Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: 0, 5, 15 and 30 min and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours (5 min before PM dose) and 5 and 15 min post PM dose
primary_outcome.description: The standard deviation of the measure is expressed as the coefficient of variation (%)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Formoterol Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve (AUC) Over Dosing Interval Following a Single Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: 0, 5, 15 and 30 min and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours (5 min before PM dose) and 5 and 15 min post PM dose
secondary_outcome.description: The standard deviation of the measure is expressed as the coefficient of variation (%)

arm_group.description: Aclidinium/formoterol 400/12μg fixed-dose combination (FDC), one inhalation twice daily (morning and evening) for 4 days, then one inhalation (morning) on Day 5 via the Almirall inhaler
Formoterol 12μg one inhalation twice daily (morning and evening) for 4 days, then one inhalation (morning) on Day 5 via the Foradil® Aerolizer®

intervention.description: Aclidinium/formoterol 400/12μg fixed dose combination (FDC), one inhalation twice daily (morning and evening) for 4 days, then one inhalation (morning) on Day 5 via the Almirall inhaler
Formoterol 12 μg one inhalation twice daily (morning and evening) for 4 days, then one inhalation (morning) on Day 5 via the Foradil® Aerolizer®

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Current or former cigarette smokers with a cigarette smoking history of at least 10 pack-years
- A diagnosis of stable moderate to severe COPD and stable airway obstruction as defined by the Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease guidelines and stable airway obstruction.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have been hospitalized for an acute COPD exacerbation within three months prior to Screening
- Any respiratory tract infection (including the upper respiratory tract) or COPD exacerbation in the six weeks before Screening
- Patients with any clinically significant respiratory conditions other than COPD
- Clinical history that suggests that the patient has asthma as opposed to COPD
- Chronic use of oxygen therapy ≥ 15 hours/day
- Patients with clinically significant cardiovascular conditions
- Patients with a history of hypersensitivity reaction to inhaled anticholinergics, beta-2 agonists, sympathomimetic amines, or inhaled medications

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted in a single center in the United States First patient visit was in January 2012 and last patient visit was in March 2012

group.title: Sequence 1
group.description: Aclidinium/formoterol 400 μg/12 μg FDC (via the Almirall inhaler) one inhalation twice daily (morning and evening) for 4 days, then one inhalation (morning) for 1 day in Period 1 and, in Period 2, Formoterol 12 μg via the Foradil® Aerolizer®, one inhalation twice daily (morning and evening) for 4 days, then one inhalation (morning) for 1 day

group.title: Sequence 2
group.description: Formoterol 12 μg via the Foradil® Aerolizer®, one inhalation twice daily (morning and evening) for 4 days, then one inhalation (morning) for 1 day in Period 1 and, in Period 2, Aclidinium/formoterol 400 μg/12 μg FDC (via the Almirall inhaler) one inhalation twice daily (morning and evening) for 4 days, then one inhalation (morning) for 1 day

group.title: Overall Study Population
group.description: All patients participating in the crossover study

outcome.title: Area Under the Formoterol Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve (AUC) Over Dosing Interval at Steady State
outcome.description: The standard deviation of the measure is expressed as the coefficient of variation (%)
outcome.time_frame: Day 1: 0, 5, 15 and 30 min and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours (5 min before PM dose) and 5 and 15 min post PM dose; Days 2-4: 0, 5 and 15 min post dose; Day 5: 0, 5, 15 and 30 min and 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours (post AM dose)
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis population included all patients who completed the study and had evaluable PK parameters

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Publication of the results by the PI will be subject to mutual agreement between the PI and sponsor.
